data.title: Nashville Area Chamber of Commerce
data.meta_description:
Nashville Area Chamber of Commerce | 26,027 followers on LinkedIn. Join us today on our mission to create regional economic prosperity by facilitating community leadership.  | For more than 175 years, the Nashville Area Chamber of Commerce has been working for Middle Tennessee's business community.

The Nashville Area Chamber is Middle Tennessee's largest business federation, representing nearly 2,000 businesses in 10 counties (Davidson, Dickson, Montgomery, Cheatham, Robertson, Wilson, Sumner, Williamson, Rutherford and Maury). Through a wide variety of programs and initiatives, the Chamber works to positively impact the economic vitality and enhance the quality of life in the region, while supporting the growth and prosperity of Chamber-member businesses.
data.text:
Congratulations to The Branch of Nashville on their ribbon cutting and rebranding!üéâ The Branch of Nashville strives to build a community where everyone can thrive by nourishing, educating, and equipping our neighbors. They do this through comprehensive care, urgent food support, English language learning, and collective action with other community partners. Thank you to everyone who attended! Tonda McKay

Interesting conversation facilitated by Denise LaGrange last week regarding Nashville‚Äôs Choose How You Move initiative. Shelly Hazle , VP of Regional Policy for Nashville Area Chamber of Commerce was onsite to give context and depth to the discussion. (Thank you! I learned so much from you!) Deborah Story , I love meeting past YW board members! Always great stories attached to these meetings. Stay tuned! I, for one, am eager to hear more about how the city is changing and how we, as citizens, can weigh in! #choosehowyoumove #nashvillechamber #transit #nashville #communitydiscussion

When you mix insightful stories about Music City with a room full of passionate people, magic happened at the Intro Nashville Alumni Reception joining the current class. Not only did we hear captivating stories about Nashville from incredible storytellers, but we also had the opportunity to make valuable connections with fellow Nashville enthusiasts. Former Mayor Bill Purcell and Nashville Area Chamber of Commerce CEO Ralph Schultz shared fascinating insights into Nashville's rich history and its promising future. Their perspectives on our city's growth and development were truly inspiring. Networking with such passionate individuals reaffirms why programs like Intro Nashville are vital for fostering community engagement and understanding. I'm grateful to be part of a network that celebrates our city's journey and looks forward to its continued success. #intronash #networking #nashville

Today was the fifth stop on TNECD's #BlackBusinessMonthTN tour. üëè Founded in Nashville 120 years ago, Citizens Savings Bank and Trust Company is the oldest continuously operating Black-owned bank in the U.S. It was established to create opportunities for African Americans to build wealth and economic security. We are grateful to have Citizens Savings Bank as a partner in supporting Tennesseans and growing our state‚Äôs economy.

Congratulations to the Nashville Stampede on their recent ribbon cutting!üéâ ü§† The Nashville Stampede is the first-ever PBR Team Series World Champion, made up of the top bull riders in the world, based out of Nashville's Bridgestone Arena. They are a family-owned team with deep roots in the Western way of life. Thank you to everyone who attended! JHR Photography LLC

üö® New partnership opportunity!üö® Did you know that when refugees arrive in the United States, they are immediately eligible to work? Our Employment team helps match newly-arrived refugees to local employment opportunities. Introducing the Preferred Refugee Employer Network! Becoming a Preferred Refugee Employer means offering support and services that are of particular help to the refugee community. To become a PRE, a company must fulfill at least five of the designated best practices for refugee employment and commit to creating an inclusive and welcoming environment. For more information on this exciting opportunity, visit our website: https://buff.ly/3X0CAya #employment #employers #nashville #nashvilletn #nashvillejobs #refugees #refugeeswelcome

The Nashville Area Chamber is excited to announce that the 2024 Nashpreneur of the Year is Monchiere' Holmes-Jones! This award is reserved for an individual in the Nashville community who exemplifies what it means to be a ‚ÄúNashpreneur‚Äù‚Äîcreative, resilient, risk-taking, and a leader who paves the way for other entrepreneurs and small businesses to succeed. Holmes-Jones is a seasoned advertising agency vet with 20+ years of experience with a blend of agency and in-house corporate brands with major industries like tourism, historical, automotive, government nonprofits, gaming, healthcare, wireless, higher education (HBCUs), tech, quick service restaurants. In 2014, she opened MOJO Marketing + PR helping real brands merge business innovation, creativity, and servant leadership together for better. Holmes-Jones will be officially recognized during the 2024 Nashpreneurs event on Wednesday, August 22nd at the Hilton Nashville Green Hills. Register for the 2024 Nashpreneurs event here: https://bit.ly/3QYb8xI Or with the link in our bio!

On September 19th, stop by our open house, Pick Your Place!‚≠ê Whether you're already a member or considering joining, this event is a great opportunity to meet Chamber staff, connect with local business leaders, and discover how membership can help your business thrive. This event is free to attend but pre-registration is strongly encouraged. Register here: https://bit.ly/4fCktWO
